description_all:
Matilde is 48 years old. She is in a common law relationship and has 2 children.
She decided to start a business selling food wholesale independently a few months ago in the city of Medellín.
Today, she wants to give her business a small push with help from Kiva and Corporación Interactuar lenders.
For this reason she needs a loan to buy clothing, accessories, luggage and catalogue merchandise.
With this loan she will be able to improve sales.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www. kiva. org/team/interactuar_colombia"

Alaa works in the docks. His dad left him a grocery store business. He made time for the business because it is the income his family depended on and still depends on. It is a good way to keep things how they were. He wants to go further and to make things even better. He is working hard to please everyone.

A loan will help him supply the grocery store. He is looking for a good future and this will only happen through hard work and a lot of effort. His dream is to officially register the store.

Jorge, age 38, is married and has two children. He lives in a municipality in the metropolitan area of Nuevo Leon. He has worked for a company for ten years.

Jorge is requesting a loan for his sister-in-law, Claudia. The loan is for her to be able to be taken care of at a private clinic because she needs gallbladder surgery. She urgently needs the surgery, and at this time does not have the money to pay in cash. That is the reason that Jorge wants to help so that she is able to recover her health and continue on with her life plans.

Emmanuel is single, twenty-six years of age, and resides in Koforidua, capital of the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emmanuel earns a living by selling vehicle spare parts and lubricants. His presence in the community is helping lots of mechanics and individuals to work on and maintain their vehicles.

Emmanuel started the business three years ago and has built it to a very appreciable level through hard work and perseverance. He possesses good customer services and works hard not to let his clients down.

Emmanuel is currently seeking financial support to buy stocks of the supplies.

Emmanuel's intention is to plow back his profits into the business. He is grateful in advance to his generous Kiva supporters.

Yeison is 29 years old. He is single and lives in the Medellín municipality.
He is a hard working person who has been developing the restaurant business for a while.
He is asking for a loan to buy meats, soft drinks, beer, oils and liqueur, among others.
This loan will bring him the opportunity to leverage his business and propel his activity significantly.
If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www. kiva. org/team/interactuar_colombia"

Oscar, 46, lives in a common-law relationship and has worked for nine years as an employee in a sheeting company.

Oscar has needed hearing aids for some time and he's no longer willing to wait more. That's why he's requesting a loan, so he can get them soon.

He hopes you can support him because he knows these hearing aids are going to help him continue with his daily activities at work and with his family.

Ramon is 72 years old. He proved that luck is nothing more than being prepared for a good opportunity. Thanks to his effort he managed to find his way to the market and now he owns a small retail business where he sells food and drinks.

The business guarantees the well-being of Ramon's family and better conditions of life for his son. Not everything was easy in Ramon's life. His family never had the resources to provide a proper education for him. For this reason he had to work in order to achieve his own goals. Ramon can be proud of himself now. He is a role-model in his community for his effort and dedication.

In order to expand his production capacity Ramon is asking for a loan to buy beer, grains, dairy products, frozen meat and other.

Esteban is a 40 year old father. He is married and has a beautiful family with whom he lives in a community in the subdivision Camache.

To make his own income and support his family he buys and sells traditional clothes. He has been working for close to 8 years in this business.

In order to continue growing his business, Esteban is applying for a loan and he will invest in in the purchase of more traditional clothes such as: blouses, belts and skirts to cover all of his customers' demands.

Richard is a single 39-year-old micro-entrepreneur who is dedicated to his dietetic cookie and cake business. He lives in the town of Soledad.

Richard prepares wholegrain cookies and cakes which he distributes to health food stores, gyms and universities. He has been engaged in this business for more than two years.

Richard decided to study since his father taught him some things in this discipline and he wanted to improve in order to carry out this activity professionally to earn a daily living. Besides, he loves this business. That is why he wants to keep growing in order to have the place he dreams of so much.

Richard currently needs an injection of capital. For this reason, he is arranging his first KIVA loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will purchase an oven to bake cookies and ingredients such as carrots, nuts, and oatmeal. Please support Richard in his loan. It will be a success.

Nelson is a hardworking, honest person who lives in the municipality of Espinal; he is 46 years old. For 10 years he has been selling foods. He started the business in an effort to support his family and get ahead. He learned from a relative and always has his goals in mind.

He is seeking a loan to help boost his business through the purchase of more supplies such as frozen goods, natural preserves and exotic fruits to offer a menu with more variety which will improve his sales.


If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia"

In the photo, Moussa is the one holding the cow's horn in his hands. He is 39 years old, married and father of four children. His children are aged from 2 to just over a year old. He has been rearing beef cows for 7 years.
He would like to develop this activity by taking a loan with RMCR. To buy beef cows. He buys his cows at the surrounding markets and makes his sales at the same markets. After these sales, he can have 60,000 to 85,000CFA as profit.
The profit will enable him to support his family in ways such as: health and education. He battles against the epidemic illnesses of these animals but he organises things to overcome this phenomenon.
In the future he expects to have more financing to grow his business and have more income in order to guarantee the future of his children.

Pictured above is Godfrey, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 36 years old and has 5 children. As a group leader, he is representing his group of 14 farmers from the Teso District, Kenya.

Godfrey is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund since this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Godfrey says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2016, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Godfrey will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8.5 acres. One member of the group will also be purchasing a solar light.

Wellen is again requesting a loan to buy more bags of coffee to sell, unlike the previous loan he used to buy manure and pesticides and pay workers to weed his coffee plantation. He is a married man with children, whereby the entire family depends on farming and produce buying for income generation.

With the previous loan proceeds, Wellen used profits to repay the loan, as well as paying school fees for the children. Since now it is the season for coffee, he wants to get involved in coffee buying and selling in order to raise income, only that his capital is not yet enough. Hence, he is requesting another loan. He says thanks for the Kiva loan which was given to him through Hofokam Limited and will be happy if his request is honored.

Roberto, 30, sells chargers and cell phone accessories. He has five years' experience and his wife helps him. Even in hard times, he always tries to stay strong and not give up when any problems arise. He is a very optimistic man, prepared to accomplish his goals for his little son, who motivates him every day. Roberto has turned to KIVA_MiCrédito for a loan to buy accessories and cell phones, to obtain higher earnings and give his son a better life. In the near future, Roberto is thinking of launching his own store at a central location in the city selling cell phones and accessories.

Claudio is a noble, kind, and enterprising person who sells food. He works independently. Claudio is the father of a son, and his loved ones are his greatest pride and reason to go to work.

Claudio decided to start his journey as an independent due to the lack of jobs in his area. This demonstrates his value and his ability to overcome problems.

He is currently applying for a loan to buy an assortment of liquor to market. He hopes that with the investment, he will manage to improve many aspects of his business. This will generate better sales, be more competitive, obtain good utility, and gain a greater number of customers.

Elkin has great experience preparing food. Sixteen years ago, he began his own business selling food retail in the municipality of Medellín which, to date, has generated very good results for him.

Currently, he needs help to purchase liquor and beer to sell. The loan will allow him to work in better conditions.

With this help, he will be able to work in a more organized way and with greater and better quality of supplies.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www. kiva. org/team/interactuar_colombia"

Jane, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega B (North) District. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children.

Jane likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2016 and decided to represent her group because she likes being a leader. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Jane plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Jane’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

Martha Isabel is 42 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellin. She’s a happy woman who has four children who are her biggest motivation. She has been a very responsible mother who has worked hard to sustain her family, and she feels proud of what she has accomplished.

She has a restaurant, and she already had a loan funded through Kiva that helped her a lot and for which she’s very grateful. Now she wants to invest in her business again to keep improving it, and she would like to make her family happy. She’s asking for a new loan to buy supplies to prepare more fast food and cooking utensils to improve her business.

Support this excellent mother and lend now.

Pictured above is JOHN, often described as an extremely resourceful person. He is 51 years old and has 5 children. As a group leader, he is representing his group of 17 farmers in Alego District, Kenya.

John is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. John says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2016, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. John will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

Meshack is 29 years old and has 2 children. He has been a farmer for 10 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Meshack is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 17 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Meshack started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2013, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.

Meshack’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 13.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

This season is not the first one that Francis is working alongside One Acre Fund. He has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2017 and, although he is the only person featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 15 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Francis is often described by his community as a very reliable person and decided to be the one to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. Like many of his fellow farmers, Francis decided he wanted to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

This loan will not only help Francis but the whole group, who will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 10 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

Patrick is a determined, married gentleman and who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He does farming as his main economic activity, majorly in banana growing. He has also rides a motorcycle as a transport business for side income for the last 6 years. He was inspired by the need to supplement his income. He is hoping to improve his farming by use of better methods of farming for better yields and sustain himself in the near future. Amidst the challenges of banana bacterial wilt, heavy winds, and price fluctuations, \n\nhe is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers  to apply to his banana plantation.

Valerio is a 53 year old man. He is in a common-law marriage, and is the father of three children, one of whom is under his care. He is considered to be a hard-working, honest, and respectful man. For nine years he has dedicated himself to selling coal. It is his sister who helps him with this business in order to improve income for his home and his family. He sells the coal in the market in his community, in general stores, and by delivery. He is essential to his family.

Today he has knocked on the doors of MiCrédito and Kiva in order to buy firewood and bags. In the not too distant future he wishes to expand his delivery route in order to reach more homes at a better price. He also continues to train his children for a professional well-being.

Mr. Soumaila, age 21, is the Signoma Group's leader. He is married and now the father of one child. He has two people in his care.

He has been selling mobile phones and accessories for three years. He gets his supplies at city markets.

With funding, he plans to buy 15 mobile phones as wells as accessories for his business. He plans to save his profits so he can expand his shop.

He aims to build a solid future for his child.

Olga is 66 years old, single, and lives with her sister. She lives in Monterrey, is pensioned, and has also worked at a secretarial uniform factory for 11 years.

She has had a chronic degenerative disease for many years, which has begun to affect her vision. She needs surgery because she has cataracts among other problems and does not have enough money to take care of it. For this, she is asking for a loan so that they can operate as soon as possible to be able to continue working and have a better quality of life.

Thank you for supporting Miguel Angel with his previous loan. He invested it in beer, soda and snacks. Thanks to the financing, he was able to increase his production capacity and he generated excellent profits and benefits. He has a message for his lenders: "Thank you for helping me to achieve my goals. I want to keep doing this life project with your support. It is fundamental for the commercial growth of my business”. This micro-businessman opened up new opportunities for the creation and generation of income. That is why, in addition to selling a variety of merchandise like snacks, potato chips, cookies and candies, he also sells beer and soda.

At this time, he is taking out his second Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. He plans to invest these resources in buying a variety of merchandise like snacks, potato chips, cookies, candies, beer and soda for the carnival season. His main goal is to expand the variety of products he provides and obtain more profits. This entrepreneur\'s dream is to own his own home open and set up his own locale. Support his in his business loan, it will be a success.

Maria is a 50-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She lives with her daughter in the municipality of Barranquilla. She has a lot of experience as a merchant. Currently, she sells and markets products such as perfumes, women's clothing and shoes, which she distributes to a select group of customers in the sector where she lives. Her aspiration is to have her own retail space in order to generate more income for the family and achieve a better standard of living. Her business was acquired with her own resources.

Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, resources which she will invest in the purchase of women's shoes. She wants to strengthen her capital and increase her sales. Support her in her loan, it will be a success.

Pictured above is Maurice, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega B (North) District, Kenya. He is a father to 10 children and is known by his community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Maurice joined One Acre Fund in 2012 because he wanted to earn enough to send his children to school. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Maurice plans to send his children to school.

Between the 12 farmers in Maurice's Group, a total of 4.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

Mery del Carmen, 58, is an entrepreneur who lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and children. This business owner used to work as a domestic employee in relatives’ homes but since she did not earn enough to support her household she decided to start a business to have better economic stability and support her children.

In 2003 she began dedicating herself completely to selling clothing, shoes and accessories. She sells them every day to her main customers who are neighbors, friends and people in the area who pay in cash.

She is currently applying for her first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to increase her work capital to buy blouses, shirts, jeans, skirts, shorts, bermudas, pants, dresses, shoes, tennis shoes, etc. for her new customers and increase sales.

Please support her business loan.

Thank you for supporting Wilber with his previous loan, with which he invested in his business plan. This allowed him to stock a greater amount of merchandise, such as clothing and shoes for women and children, to offer his customers. Wilber is a micro-entrepreneur who appreciates very much the opportunity he received by getting financing which boosted him to improve his quality of life and the stability of his business. With this business, he has managed to support his family and get financial stability.

He is very grateful to his funders and sent them a message, "Thank you for the received help, and I want to work with FMSD and Kiva so that my situation improves even more." At this opportunity, he is applying for his second loan, to invest in shoes, jeans, blouses, sweaters, children\'s clothing, school supplies, and stationery.

His goal is to get more income and to strengthen his business even more in this way. Support him with his business loan, it will be a success.

Pictured above is Everlyne, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 40 years old and has 7 children. As a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. 

Everlyne is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Everlyne says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2016, she has learnt alot from farming trainings, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Everlyne will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

I was born and raised in Germany,  where I was trained as a dental assistant. I came to the USA and continued my dental career, which has lasted 39 years. I enjoyed helping patients, educating them about their oral  and overall health and  having personal relationships.  When I became unemployed in April of 2019, I knew I had to make a change from dentistry.  So, I went back to school! I am now a licensed esthetician with the same ambitions: work with people and help them to improve their health. I'm looking forward to many lasting relationships with my clients and their amazing faces.

Victor is a person who smiles, a lover of life who fights for his dreams and goals, such as having his own house and a large business with many employees where he can enjoy life. But he is going to have to work very hard to make his dreams reality. He makes a living preparing food products. His business will be his symbol of strength and he is very determined that he will fulfill each one of his dreams with it's support.

Victor is requesting a loan to buy ice-pops, chocolate bananas and nougats and improve his freezer or buy a new one. This investment will allow him to have the opportunity to raise his level of competitiveness in the area as to merchandise, prices and what he offers.

A desire to move ahead and fight for a future motivated Atanael to start a mechanics shop. His business has provided him the opportunity to radically change his life.

Atanael lives in the town of Ibague. He is a dedicated, honest and hardworking person who seeks to move forward every day, and to generate employment for people like him, who at some moment went through very complicated times when no one would extend them a hand.

Atanael is seeking a loan to buy inventory, such as new and used rims, and tires. He will also buy hand tools and make improvements to the floor of his shop. This is a much needed support for him to continue in financial growth, and to improve his sales and earnings.

Atanael sees himself as a great businessman. He repeats it to himself every day in his mind. From your hand you can help him reach his big goals.

Pictured above is Linus, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 39 years old and has 5 children. As a group leader, he is representing his group of 8 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Linus is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Linus says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2017, he has learnt a lot from farming trainings, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Linus will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

Pictured above is Deffin, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 47 years old and has 6 children. As a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Deffin is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Deffin says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2016, she has learnt a lot from farming trainings, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Deffin will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

Filiberto David is a micro-entrepreneur of 37 years of age who lives in the city of Barranquilla along with his wife and his children. This entrepreneur sells supplies for dressmaking, an activity that generates a very good profitability, and thus he offers his family economic stability and a better quality of life. He has a significant number of loyal customers to whom he offers a wide range of products such as threads, laces, spools, and buttons, among other items, at very good prices.

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in the purchase of threads, buttons, wide ribbons, and headbands, among other items. Filiberto has the necessary infrastructure to expand the inventory of products in his business, and for this he needs an injection of capital in order to strengthen and generate greater income.

Help him with his loan! He will be a success.

Benson, a cattle keeper/trader, is a married man of forty years with 4 children, 3 of whom are going to school. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He earns a living from rearing cattle, farming coffee, and growing bananas. He and his wife work hard to generate income for their family, with their efforts geared towards educating their children up to the levels required for self-reliance. For more than 15 years, the family's major source of income has been cattle.

Benson’s business needs expansion. He has capital challenges, but his business is profitable, so he is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more cows for resale to raise his income.

Lucia is a woman who works hard every day so her family can live better. She is content because thanks to the loan she received things went well and she was able to buy what she needed to improve coffee production.

In order to continue improving her crop she is applying for a loan to buy farm supplies for this year’s crop season.

Manuel, 45 years old, has more than 10 years' experience selling new clothing and kitchen utensils. For him, his child is of the greatest importance for him. He strives ceaselessly every day. He's a persistent man, disposed to continue fighting to give the best life to his child and to be able to defray some household expenses.

Manuel has come to Kiva and MiCrédito to take a loan to buy blankets, shorts, and pans, in order to diversify his business and continue expanding, little by little.

In the short term, Manuel is thinking of converting his business selling clothes into a store with new clothing.

Thank you for supporting Gerardo Luis in his previous loan which he used to purchase supplies for his hairdressing services such as a new hair dryer, a hair iron, and beauty products such as straighteners, keratin treatments, scalp massagers, etc.

This micro-entrepreneur from the town of Soledad is very satisfied with the economic support he received with his previous Kiva loan which helped him open new doors at a commercial level and increase his profits. Gerardo is sending a message to his lenders: "I am very grateful for your financial support. My client base has increased and with this my quality of life has improved. Thank you for believing in me".

Gerardo is currently arranging his second Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to purchase a new hair dryer, a hair iron, and beauty products such as straighteners, keratin treatments, scalp massagers etc.

This entrepreneur believes that organization and innovation are the keys to success so he always tries to be at the forefront of the latest beauty equipment and tools to always be competitive.

Please support Gerardo in his loan! It will be a success.

Don Jarington is 34 years old, and is passionate about his work. From very early in the morning he begins his arduous labour with lots of love and care.

For him, his children are his source of inspiration. He has 10 years of experience selling groceries, and is thrilled to count on the mutual support of his wife, who has been with him since he started selling clothes, and even today now that he has another source of income.

Jarington has again come knocking on the door of Kiva/MiCrédito for a loan to buy cleaning and hygiene products wholesale. He hopes to earn a better income in order to make improvements to his home and improve his family's quality of life. In the near future, Jarington envisions himself as the owner of a grocery store in a central location in the city.

I started working as a salesman on the floor covering store selling, carpet, wood, laminate, ceramic and vinyl floors in 1998. After working for a couple of years as a salesman for a flooring store I started my installation business and became a certified laminate and wood floor installer. From 2001 to 2006 I was installing carpet, wood, laminate and ceramic tiles. Then I started my own floor covering shop at home business. As I started going to client homes for floors installation it became an everyday thing that every house I went to had some sort of work, either remodeling or new construction. That’s how I got into the construction business. I’ve extensive hands-on experience in construction. I’ve built two houses back in New York in 2002 and 2003. \r\nUnfortunately, I got divorced in 2007 and then I got into bad accident in 2008 which left me disabled for 2 years. I recovered from shoulder surgery in 2010. That’s how I lost my business and my clients. Because I couldn’t work for 3 years. After recovering from my surgery I started working for Worldwide floor store 2011. In March 2012 I decided to move to San Francisco California.\r\nMy motivation is to resolve problems and see the transformation of every project. I\'m really happy when my clients smile and say "thank you".

Héctor is a 69 year old micro-entrepreneur who resides in the city of  Barranquilla. His main business is selling merchandise which he brings in and is sent to him from the United States. He travels every three months making the most of the opportunity he has. Besides this he is retired and receives a monthly payment from his country. He operates this business motivated to find other sources of income for his family. He is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing he has made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of clothing, footwear and perfumes. Support him with his loan. It will be a success.

Alfredo Javier is a 54-year-old small business owner. He is a resident of the city of Cartagena, where lives with his wife. He has a kiosk located in front of his home, where he sells candy, snacks, and refreshments.

Alfredo Javier started this business approximately 10 years ago because of a lack of job opportunities and a desire to provide his family with better financial stability. He earns a living offering his products, starting very early each day, for cash payments and credit to his main customers, who are his neighbors and passersby in the area.

He is currently arranging a Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the purchase of supplies, groceries, and a freezer. His goal is to increase his sales and his profits. Support him with a loan for his business.

Luis is 58 years old, and is an honest and responsible man. For the past 20 years, he has had a small shop in the region where he lives, where sells fish, refreshments, sodas, candies, fried foods and other personal hygiene products and household items. His family is his pillar to be better each day.

He is going for a new loan from Kiva with MiCrédito, with which he is planning to purchase underwear and sandals to diversify his store and support the demand of his clients. In the very near future, he would like to become self-sufficient.

Pictured above is Moses, often described as an extremely friendly person. He is 52 years old and has six children. As a group leader, he is representing his group of nine farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Moses is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Moses says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2016, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Moses will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase enough seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres.

El Calvario Samayac 1 Group is made up of four women entrepreneurs. One of them is Ofelia.

Ofelia is a woman with great aspirations in life. She is thankful to ADICLA for the support they provided with the previous loan, because it allowed her to strengthen her business and continue growing her sales.

In order to continue improving her income, Ofelia has decided to venture into the beauty product selling business. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase beauty products, like perfumes, creams, lipsticks, and makeup, to sell to her clients; in addition to the sales of her silver jewellery products.

She is confident this new credit will help improve her family's standard of living.

I was raised in Milwaukee, WI. I always loved working on cars with my family. Growing up around cars and learning about them inspired me to work in the automotive field. Fabio lives in the municipality of Anz. He is 39 years old and currently works as an independent coffee grower, a trade he learned from his parents. They taught him to earn a living honestly.

Juan is a hardworking father who has been cultivating crops for several years. He is very pleased with the assistance from his previous loan, which allowed him to acquire land since he was lacking the space to continue expanding his crops.

In the early 90\'s I was a member of the platinum selling girl group, "Seduction" which brought forth the hits, "You\'re My One & Only", "Heartbeat", "Could This Be Love", and "Two To Make It Right". Like many girl groups of the past, we all went our separate ways. I kept myself busy by earning a BA from Howard University\'s School of Communication, starting an entertainment company (AVH Entertainment) and touring internationally as a singer-songwriter and actress. I toured for several years while my Mom built her catering business. She invited me to partner with her, but I did not think I had the time to assist her fully so I would help when I was in town and in any other way that I could.\r\n\r\nIn 2011 my Mom passed away and I was devastated to the point that I did not feel like I could live without her. I leaned on my faith heavily and began using her recipes to bake, to ease my grief. I felt like my entertainment career kept me away from her and the rest of my family and I no longer had any passion or desire for it. Baking became my life passion!

Oscar is 37 years old, married to Maria de Los Angeles, and has two children. He has worked as a government employee for 20 years.

Oscar's mother-in-law needs to have surgery on her right eye. She began having vision problems a long time ago but never had them addressed for financial reasons. Now her situation is much worse, so Oscar wants to help her by requesting a loan so that she can have surgery as soon as possible. As a result, his mother-in-law will have a better quality of life.

Mr. Madi, 36, is married and a father of four children — the oldest of whom is 17 and the youngest is 10. Four of his children go to school and he has two people in his care.

José is a 44-year-old man. He graduated from the University in Bachelor of Business Administration. He has 3 years experience in the area of trade. Currently he is the owner of a small bookstore. With the profits generated, he will improve his family's standard of living, re-invest in his activity and save.

Maria is 47 years old, single, and lives in the town of Puerto Triunfo. She currently works in the retail sale of textile products. This is how she has made income to support her home.

With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Fredrick plans to send his children to school.

Between the 11 farmers in Fredrick's Group, a total of 16.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, one of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light with this loan, so the group will also receive one solar light.

Sergio is a systems engineer, and he's worked designing and selling decorative items for more than 5 years, when his mother, who is an expert in this topic, taught him.

His dream is to have all the infrastructure of machinery and tools to be more integrated into the market, and his own business location, to expand his business and earn income to improve his quality of life.

In the market, he's had requests for reminders and designs for invitation cards, and he's taken pains to meet these requests. Orders have been from his neighbors, family members, referred individuals, and the general public.

Sergio works with his sister-in-law from 9 in the morning until 7 at night every day in order to attain is personal and professional goals.

His providers are supplies and wholesale merchants located in the municipality of Soledad and the city of Barranquilla.

Currently, he's applying for a loan with which he'll buy paper goods, paints, adhesives, and wood, among other primary materials, for making the beautiful decorative articles that are requested, focusing on the nature of carnival in Barranquilla.

With this loan, he'll increase his sales volume and improve the liquidity of his business, serving his clients in an timely manner.

I was born in a US Military hospital in Tehran, Iran during the Iranian revolution.  My parents left everything to flee to the United States when I was two. They rebuilt their lives and became successful entrepreneurs.  I was raised in Long Beach, CA and my parents work ethics rubbed off on me.\r\n\r\nWhen I turned eighteen I worked for Starbucks for five years.  During that time I also took a year sabbatical to study abroad in Spain and Italy. This is where I got introduced to the European  cafe culture.  Working for Starbucks gave me my passion of working with people and learning their system gave me the tools to keep an organized back of house.  My business plan is a hybrid of the two formulas. Starbucks systemic approach and their commitment to excellence in customer service combined with Italian food, beverage, and the people watching culture.

Edinson is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Villeta. He’s a hardworking man who comes from a very humble family, so he had to start working at a very young age. To provide what is necessary for her child, Estela sells hair accessories and products for personal use by catalog. She takes advantage of selling in the local market where she offers her product. Estela shares, "I am happy because I can run my own business and take care of my son." During the school season Estela has a high demand for the product. Estela and the rest of her classmates have little or no formal education. Because of this, they hope to receive training on business, health, women and family issues. They are part of the 30,000 clients of Puente de Amistad who participate in the Microcredit Plus program (loans, education, health). During the educational training, they learn to manage their animal husbandry, hair accessories, products for personal use by catalog, basic grains, flower sales and traditional clothing businesses.

Thank you very much, Kiva lenders, for your generosity in financing these much needed loans!

Hilda is 33 years old and lives and works in Cadereyta with her family. She comes for a dental exam since she says that she has problems. She cannot eat freely and is very sensitive. She also has a lot of pain.

Ricardo is 39 years old and married with three children. He has worked for 15 years as an employee of a governmental institution.

A desire to move forward and fight for his future motivated William to start his retail business selling food and drinks. This business has provided him the opportunity to radically change his life.

William sees himself as the best businessman. He repeats this to himself every day in his mind. With your help he can achieve big goals.

He works daily with his maximum effort and all his energy since he wishes to genera employment in the future and be positioned as one of the best entrepreneurs of the area.

This is a necessary investment to improve productivity, inventory rotation, sales, and positioning; therefore, with this support, he will be able to strive for better sales and income in the future.

Jhosman works to be an agent of change. He does not only want to changes his life and those of his loved one, but also wants to support the community, to those people who don't have a job so someone can lend them a hand.

I was raised in South Korea and was the first person to attend and graduate from university in my family. Most of my family were against it and thought it was useless, but my older siblings who had the most influence on me said it is great to take on new opportunities. I listened to their teachings and faced the upcoming opportunities, bad or good.

I majored and graduated with a degree in computer science in 1990. I worked as software developer and a software sales manager from 1990 to 2001 in South Korea. With this background I moved to the states with my family to start a business that would complement my work ethics and background. 

What motivates me to be successful in my business is my family. As an immigrant it was difficult to absorb the change in scenery. My wife and my two sons motivated me to find the right foundation for my business and my passion for the business. And I learned how much my family has strengthened me through those hard times.

Sonia, the second one in the photo, is the group's leader. She is married and lives in a rented place with her husband and children. She is a real fighter and is very dedicated. She sells cosmetics door-to-door and advertises her business to expand her reach. She dreams of having a large store to better serve her customers and to have her own home.

The loan will be used to buy makeup, moisturizers, and perfumes.

The group is grateful to the investors for their support.

Juan is 53 years old, married, and has lived in Apodaca for seven years. He has worked as a teacher for 15 years.

Juan is requesting a loan because he has a few dental problems. He needs to have some cleaning and rearrangement since a few of his teeth are missing. His self-esteem is very low, so he would like to begin treatment as soon as possible.

Juan hopes to have the support of the lenders so that he can resolve this problem. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

This season is not the first one that Stanley is working alongside One Acre Fund. He has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2015, and, although he is the only person featured in the photo above, he is actually representing his group of 17 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Stanley is often described by his community as a very hardworking individual and decided to be the one to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. Like many of his fellow farmers, Stanley decided he wanted to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to have access to quality training and new farming methods. He hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

This loan will not only help Stanley but the whole group, who will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

John is 30 years old and lives in the municipality of Villeta. He’s a very humble man who works making and installing security doors, a hard job, but one that helps him a lot.

John has been doing this for 10 years and he decided to become independent, looking for a better income to help his family. He’s a kind and friendly man, who dreams of giving a good quality of life to his family.

John needs a little help to improve his business to be more profitable, so he can have a better economic situation to help his loved ones. He’s asking for a loan to buy a cutting machine and a computer to better manage his business.

Support this humble entrepreneur and loan now.

Christine is a 57-year-old proud mother of 4 children. She is a group leader who is often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Alego District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2016, Christine has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Christine described her harvest last year as good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Christine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 11.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

Murad opened his store as a sign of his interest in progress. He is accomplished in his education and his lifestyle. He is a role model to many. He has succeeded at everything he was put to. Now, the new challenge is the store, and he is showing signs of very smart decisions. He is treating his customers with a great deal of respect, and they keep coming back. His management is what keeps the store clean and running swiftly. A loan will help him supply his store with nuts, a popular and healthy snack that compliments his customers' taste.

Nicolas is 30 years old, he makes a living selling food. He has always been an entrepreneur, he is self taught and inquisitive and wants to do something valuable with his life.
As a result, today he has his own business; he is a producer and a vendor. Nicolas is very versatile; in the face of personal and market difficulties he looks for ways to excel. In the future he wants to leave behind a successful business. This borrower is an active, enterprising man dedicated to his work. He is applying for a loan in order to buy smoked bacon, sauces, potatoes and disposable items. Nicolas dreams of making a success of his business, giving him the chance to continue to provide financial support and guarantee stability for his loved ones and family.

Thanks for supporting Nayibis with her previous loan which she invested in buying clothing, footwear, perfume, accessories, etc. This financing allowed her to improve her profit margin and her family enjoyed greater benefits. She also thinks she improved the condition of her business and had an excellent variety of articles in which she invested. Nayibis is very grateful to her financiers and sends them a message ” Thank you very much for your support. My purchasing capacity has grown and with it my power to negotiate. I would like to continue to have your support".

She is currently applying for her next loan from Kiva to invest in the purchase of merchandise like clothing, footwear, perfume, women\'s accessories, etc. This enterprising woman wants to continue to capitalize her business and improve her inventory to increase her profits and improve her quality of living. Support her with her loan. It will be successful.

Joao is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellin. He’s a caring man who is very proud of his family. They make him very happy. He always wanted to be independent and to have his own business, so he has made that dream come true and is very motivated.

He has a fast food business, in which he’s very talented, which explains why he’s been doing well. He would like to formalize his business, so it can be sustainable, and he dreams of buying a house where he can live with his family. He’s asking for a loan to buy a hot dog cart and supplies to prepare more food in order to do better.

Support this amazing entrepreneur and loan now.

Mohamed was in Syria. He was in university studying for a Master's degree when all hell broke loose, and he had to return home.

At home he needed something to do, so he opened a clothing store and became a businessman. He loves it. His customers mean the world to him, and the work environment can't be better. His town is in extreme poverty, and he knows that his business encourages progress in growth in the community. There isn't a lot of funding because of the bad economic situation of the town.

He is in need of getting new clothes to keep the business. A loan will help him finance a purchase of clothing for his community. His dream is to open stores in other towns.

Pictured above is Richard, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Lugari District, Kenya. He is a father to seven children and is known by his community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Richard joined One Acre Fund in 2012 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Richard plans to send his children to school.

Between the 11 farmers in Richard's Group, a total of 13.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

Grupo Recuerdo 2 is composed of four female entrepreneurs. One of them is Lucía. She is a great person who works very hard to improve her living conditions. She has worked, the last few years, selling various food items and selling traditional Guatemalan clothing items.

With the last loan received, Lucía was able to invest in her food selling business and things have, thankfully, gone well. She desires to continue prospering with her business ventures. For this reason, she has requested a loan that she will use to invest in the purchase of typical Guatemalan clothing items like 'huipils' (a traditional Guatemalan garment), sashes and other clothing products she can then sell to meet customer demand.

Silas, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Teso District. He is 54 years old, married, and has two children.

Silas likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2015 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Silas plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Silas’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights with this loan.

José is a 23-year-old young man, who is in a common-law relationship. He is the father of a little girl. He lives with his new family in his parents’ house, in the Santa Rosa sector. José works hard since he desires the well-being of his family. His income is from raising cattle and farming. They are jobs that he learned from his parents, who are humble farmers and have managed to struggle and educate their children with good values.

José is requesting his first loan with the goal of investing a little in calves and farm supplies for his parcel of potatoes. This is how this responsible young man will be able to continue working and improving his family’s quality of life since, in the future, he aspires to plant larger quantities to be able to build his own house.

Monic is a member of Kabaare 1 Tutungukye Group, where each member guarantees one another to access a loan. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, and is blessed with three children, two of whom are students.

She is mainly in farming, mostly growing cassava, matooke, maize and beans but on a small scale where she solely earns a living.

Her wish is to get enough money to look after her family as well as educate her children to higher levels of education. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital and bad weather conditions that affect her crops and her animals.

She is requesting a loan to pay workers clearing her gardens for this season.

Thanks for supporting Duvan David in his previous loan, with which he invested in the purchase of a specialized barber chair and supplies such as dyes, scissors, keratin, etc. Thanks to this, his business was much improved, which was recognized by his clientele, and he had higher profitability. He sends a message to his lenders: \'Thanks for your support. I am an organized and well-known micro-entrepreneur."

Now he is applying for his second Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in the purchase of merchandise such as shampoo, talc, blades, scissors, combs, wax, gel, styling cream, antibacterial lotion, etc. Duvan wishes to have financial support, and thus to be able to add capital to his business to better serve clients and to improve his income. Support his business loan; it will be a success.

Pictured above is Fransisca, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 52 years old and has six children. As a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Alego District, Kenya.

Fransisca is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund, which means that she will be able to earn enough to feed her family. That is why she decided to join in the first place. Fransisca says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2016, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. She will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights, the group will also receive two solar lights.

I am fueled by creating soulful, passion-based organizations. I own Thrive Yoga Fruita and Thrive Yoga Crested Butte, a nation-wide events business, is an international community & economic development consultant and am actively growing Prana-Preneurs, a conscious entrepreneur coaching program to help individuals and studios radiate the positive effects of a living yoga practice!

I believes that mindfulness, compassion and a global focus can change an international capitalistic climate. We can create long-lasting change; via one individual and one organization at a time. I apply the principles of yoga to my daily life and my daily practice permeates all avenues of how I run my businesses and interact with the world. 

I have been blessed to step out of the norm and truly live as a Prana-Preneur. It has been an adventure; full of risk, fear, contemplation, challenge, patience, energy, grit and abundance. I know  that it's not about the summit, it's about the journey. Everyday is an adventure, full of opportunities to continue to thrive and benefit all beings.

Bernabe is a 67-year-old man, always faithful to his principles, a person who struggles and works for his family, for his dreams, and for a goal, which is to enjoy a better future and have the tools to build a great tomorrow. He works selling food and beverages retail, a business he began in the year 1989 as an alternative to generate income since work was scarce.

Currently, due to the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to purchase an inventory of pasta, rice, soap, and deodorant. He hopes that, with this investment, he will be able to improve the productive processes, sales, income, and competitiveness in the zone.

Without imagining that design could become my passion and talent, I studied Graphic Design in Venezuela and specialized in Editorial Design in Buenos Aires, Argentina. While studying my specialization I also studied Creativity Below The Line (BTL), and to my surprise I discovered the fascinating world of advertising and marketing.\r\n \r\nSince then I have not stopped working, studying and specializing in areas such as: Social Media and Online Marketing, Social Network Management and Personal Brand, my favorite area today.

Micaela is a 34-year-old married mother who lives with her beautiful family in a community in the neighborhood of Guineales. She generates her own income and supports her family with the household expenses by buying and selling traditional clothes. Her business has been in existence for eight years and she sells along one of the main streets in her community.

Eager to continue growing her business, Micaela is requesting a new loan in order to buy traditional clothes such as blouses, sashes, and skirts. This will help her to continue attracting customers with more modern clothes at affordable prices. By acquiring a certain quantity of products, she will be able to sell at lower prices.

Her greatest wish is to strengthen her business and improve her family's income.

Fernando, 59, is a widower and has two children. He has worked for seven years in a consultancy firm.

Fernando's requesting a loan because he needs some hearing aids that the doctor prescribed for him. He greatly needs them because he doesn't hear very well, which bothers him a lot. It affects him in the work and family environments.

That's why Fernando hopes you can support him to continue with his normal life.

Otoniel is 52 years old, and a warrior who has fought many battles. Thanks to his retail business, he has improved his financial situation and become self-sufficient. Otoniel has four children. They are his light; the reason he gets up every morning is to give them all he can. Otoniel has a business that is growing.

He needs your support to inject capital to his business as he is looking to increase sales and income.
Otoniel is applying for a loan to buy jars, nail clippers, nail varnish, cups, bottles, bowls, dishes, buckets, spoons, and more.

Otoniel hopes to achieve his goals of paying for his children’s education, and of owning a house, which he will achieve through the fruits of her labour.

Donald is a 44 year old man. He is an agricultural producer with 30 years experience in this economic sector. Currently, he is dedicated to planting maize. He is part of a large family since he is the parent to 8 children. He is very happy to be able to count on the support of his children and wife. His age is not an impediment to achieve his goals.

Donald has knocked on Kiva's and Micredito's doors again with the objective of being the beneficiary of a loan to buy cattle feed and be able to keep offering quality milk. In the near future, Donald is thinking of becoming a dairy broker as well as being able to develop the preparation and sale of cheese in the markets.

Santulino, pictured above, has been a farmer for 17 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 13 farmers from the Teso District. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 children.

Santulino likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2016 and decided to represent his group, because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Santulino plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Santulino’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6 acres of land.

Rosalio, 48, is a very optimistic, industrious man with a hardworking spirit. He is a farmer, who has been engaged in planting corn, beans, and wheat for twenty-eight years. For him, his three children are his fundamental pillar of support, and they motivate him to achieve all his goals, despite his age.

Rosalio has come to the Kiva and MiCrédito lenders to purchase supplies such as organic fertilizer and minerals for the soil to prevent blight in the crops and harvest quality products at very good prices. In the short-term, he plans to purchase a vehicle to deliver the orders for his products.

Jane is 60 years old and has one child. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Jane is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega B (North) District, Kenya.

Jane started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2014 and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since joining, she has seen her life improve, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant 4.5 acres of land.

Guadalupe is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has worked for 20 years doing residential maintenance.

Guadalupe is asking for a loan because he needs surgery on his left eye because he has a cataract and also has internal leakage in both eyes. But, he does not have the resources at this time to have the surgery.

He hopes that you can support him so that he can get it taken care of as soon as possible and improve his vision since he is the only breadwinner of his family.

Mr. Jean is married and the father of 3 children. The oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 22 months. Two of his children go to school, and he is taking care of 5 people.

Jean has been selling diverse products such as gas, charcoal, iron, etc for 4 years. He gets his supplies from a market in the city.

With the borrowed money, he plans to buy 1 barrel of gas, 80 bags of charcoal, and 2 tons of iron for his business and to save his earnings.

He wants to save the earnings from the loan. He has ambitions to grow his field of work and to better take care of his family.

Elias, age 52, is in a common-law marriage and has two children. He has had his own business for ten years.

His wife has problems with her uterus, and she needs treatment. She has not been able to be taken care of due to the lack of financial resources.

That is why Elias is requesting a loan so that the family's finances are not affected and to be able to have his wife taken care of so that her problem is resolved and she can have a better quality of life.

Myrna is 30 years old and has been married for 4 years. She has worked in an office for 4 years. Her spouse has been a contractor for 15 years.

Myrna is asking for a loan for her father-in-law because he needs surgery on his right eye and injections in both eyes since he has internal leakage.

As he does not have enough money for the operation, Myrna hopes that you can support her so that her father-in-law can get the operation and improve his quality of life.

David is the group leader of his group in Alego District, and he is representing nine farmers, including himself. David joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Like many other farmers, David decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

David's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light, and even though David decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

Rafael Enrique is 47 years old. He is separated. He lives in the city of Soledad with his family. He has more than 12 years of business experience selling fruits and vegetables. He stated with a small fruit and vegetable stand, a business he inherited from his family. His main customers are neighbors, friends, relatives, and passers-by. His business is located in a well-situated position and because of his extensive experience, he has an excellent customer base. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has done through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the purchase of seasonal fruits like mangoes, plums, tamarinds, Spanish limes, and vegetables in general. Rafael dreams about having a store location of his own and giving his family a better quality of life. Support his loan, it will be a success.

Samuel's general goods business is doing well. He was able to buy more of his stock with the financial support he received from the Kiva community. This increased his sales, which he reinvested into the business.

Samuel needs to buy more stock than he anticipated previously. He has thus approached Advans for another loan to help him buy more stock and increase his revenue.

Samuel is hopeful of getting his loan funded to continue to serve the needs of his customers.

He says thank you in advance for supporting his business.

Eduardo is a 69-year-old man who is married and has one child. He has been retired for 30 years.

Eduardo needs hearing aids because he is not able to hear well at his age. For this reason, he is requesting a loan because he does not want to deplete his capital in order to buy the hearing aids. As a result, he will be able to have a better quality of life.

John has a lot of experience in the preparation of foods. Some months ago, he began his own business of selling wholesale food products in the city of Medellín, and so far, it has generated very good results for him.

Now he needs some help for the purchase of snacks and soft drinks. The loan will allow him to work in better conditions, and he will be able to guarantee the quality of his preparations.

With this help, he will be able to work in a more organized manner and with a bigger and better quantity of supplies.

Heriberto is a hardworking person with a big heart. He is a humble and reasonable person, both characteristics of the inhabitants of the town Cañasgordas. He is in a common-law relationship and has 2 children.

Álvaro needs an injection of capital to strengthen his business. Support him in his business loan, it will be a success.

She is optimistic of expanding her farm, but the only serious challenge is inadequate capital and unfavorable weather changes. Jorge is 39 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellin. He’s happily married and he has a beautiful daughter. His family is what Jorge cares about the most, since they are his complete happiness.

Ice cream has always been my favorite treat. It's pretty awesome that many people can say the same thing, and that makes me smile. As a native of Queens, New York, I grew up among creative Asian-American culinary delights and developed a particular affinity for American ice cream. I started Noona’s Ice Cream in 2016 with a love for being a noona (meaning big sister) and passion for making Asian-inspired ice cream flavors in most surprising and delicious ways.

The first ice cream flavor I created for Noona's is called "Toasted Rice" ice cream, which became the crowd favorite at local markets. My inspiration for Noona's Ice Cream has always been the Korean flavors that I grew up with, and the inspiration for Noona's Toasted Rice flavor comes from a traditional Korean rice snack called "Noo-Roong-Ji". I reimagined this rice snack into an ice cream flavor by toasting raw rice then steeping it into fresh cream, so the toasty flavors of the rice infuse the cream. This flavor resonates with many people because rice is a beloved staple ingredient found in most cultures. After sharing it with family, friends, and neighbors, word spread and it wasn't too soon after that I began hand-delivering my ice creams all across the 5 boroughs of NYC.

I like to think of Noona’s flavors as a representation of my Asian-American identity and all the people that contribute to making America a vibrant place of opportunity and change. My goal is to build an ice cream company that not only provides delicious ice cream but also mentors young people who want to become food entrepreneurs. It means so much to me to be a positive influence on younger people, because I was fortunate to have had many people to look up to when I was a kid.

My father was a social worker so I grew up hearing heartbreaking stories of people who were struggling. I've always wanted to find a way to support those who work hard but just can't seem to get ahead.  While in college, I worked for the Department of Parks and Recreation where I supervised a small group and organized after school and summer programs for at-risk teens. That was about 20 hours a week. I picked up additional work within the Facility Maintenance department cleaning public buildings the city owned. That job was great because it combined my love of helping a group of people who needed it and cleaning!\r\n\r\nI met my wife at Doordash. We were both working in the Operations department. We spoke a lot to the drivers who delivered food. They would call in and complain about all sorts of issues. That's where we realized that the people on the ground in the gig economy are really underserved. They get lured in by the idea of flexible schedules, low barriers to entry, and quick payouts for easy jobs. But at the end of the day most still don't make enough to earn a living. Or they don't have the benefits of sick days or PTO or insurance. We wanted to change that.

Born and raised in Oakland, Cordell spent his youth under the wing of his mother. She guided him to pursue basketball to keep him off of the streets, leading to a college basketball scholarship where he took advantage of the opportunity to learn about business administration. Unbeknownst to her, he also drew inspiration from her 14 years as a foster parent. Seeing her generosity to take in youth and provide them with a sense of family and shelter, Cordell developed a curiosity about pursuing real estate as a means to help others find secure, reliable housing. Cordell pursued a commercial real estate license and applied his personal curiosity to developing a platform, Small Apartment Investors, where he regularly posts information about small apartment leasing. Now, he has developed Small Apartment Inspectors to facilitate affordable access to digital property management for small mom-and-pop property owners, who would regularly use paper instead of large-scale enterprise software. Small Apartment Inspectors functions as an extension of Cordell’s passion for real estate and helping make the lives of others easier while providing adequate shelter.

I grew up in New York City and moved to the Bay Area in 2002 to earn my BFA. My plan was to be an artist. I never thought I would be a small business owner. After I graduated I worked retail jobs to support my art, moving up until I became the Visual Manager for the Bloomingdale’s in Palo Alto. At the same time my partner Ceppie and I were opening our live/ work studio monthly to show our art. Bloomingdale’s was a great job but it wasn’t my passion.

3 years ago I watched my brother and Ceppie work together to hand carve 4 mahogany picture frames for a set of my monoprints. I realized this exceptional craft of frame making was becoming a lost art. I took what I had learned from Bloomingdale’s about creating impactful shopping spaces, leading a team of creative people, energizing your customers, and then I took a leap of faith. I started my business with Ceppie because I wanted to preserve the rich history of picture frame making. 

Now I am the proud owner of Factory 44 West, a custom picture frame shop located in Oakland, CA.

He approaches Corporación Interactuar with the intention of asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of materials to do maintenance on his cargo motorcycle, related to the motor, tires, and lights, and also to improve the garage where he stores it since, with such downpours, water is coming in.
